objectivesList.presetDescription: 1. Acclimatising the targeted data to suit the modelling technique(s) and meet its/ their modelling requirements in terms of their input data structure, data types, file format, size and quality.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 1. Acclimatising the targeted data to suit the modelling technique(s) and meet its/ their modelling requirements in terms of their input data structure, data types, file format, size and quality.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 2. Preparing the metabolomics data for model building and training, as well as for model testing and evaluation.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 2. Preparing the metabolomics data for model building and training, as well as for model testing and evaluation.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 3. The data acclimatisation procedures must be carried out in light of the defined process objectives and to fulfil those precise objectives intended by the selected data mining modelling technique(s).
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 3. The data acclimatisation procedures must be carried out in light of the defined process objectives and to fulfil those precise objectives intended by the selected data mining modelling technique(s).

objectivesList.presetDescription: 4. The requirements of data acclimatisation procedures must be considered including: time, cost, expertise as well as software and hardware infrastructures.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 4. The requirements of data acclimatisation procedures must be considered including: time, cost, expertise as well as software and hardware infrastructures.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 5. The data acclimatisation procedures must be adequate, sufficient and comprehensive to cover all the data required for model building, training and testing.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 5. The data acclimatisation procedures must be adequate, sufficient and comprehensive to cover all the data required for model building, training and testing.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 6. The data acclimatisation procedures must not influence the data through twisting, drifting, or changing their meanings, and must not cause problems, gaps, or loses of information.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 6. The data acclimatisation procedures must not influence the data through twisting, drifting, or changing their meanings, and must not cause problems, gaps, or loses of information.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 7. Acclimatisation must avoid the issues which may lead to model over-fitting or under-fitting.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 7. Acclimatisation must avoid the issues which may lead to model over-fitting or under-fitting.

objectivesList.presetDescription: 8. Acclimatisation should consider selecting more than one technique (compound modelling) which involves sub-modelling, e.g. PCA-ANN. Sub-modelling should be performed iteratively within the boundaries and context of data acclimatisation.
objectivesList.customisedDescription: 8. Acclimatisation should consider selecting more than one technique (compound modelling) which involves sub-modelling, e.g. PCA-ANN. Sub-modelling should be performed iteratively within the boundaries and context of data acclimatisation.
